Reviews.Title: Great picture and easy install!
Reviews.Author: J. Patterson
Reviews.Content: Until 6 months ago I had never heard of Ubiquiti, now I'm a huge fan of their products.  I was looking for an outdoor IP camera in the $100 range.  I of course wanted to get a nice picture out of it and didn't want a lot of headaches when it came to installing.  I'm happy to say this met all my needs.This was my first experience with POE (power over ethernet) devices and have to say I love it!  For those that like to buy the DVR with 4 cameras it is a similar concept.  You don't need to run a long extension cord or worry about outside electrical boxes.  You just use the same Ethernet cables as you plug right into your computer and it powers the device.  It comes with a POE injector which is the little box that you do plug into an outlet.  I ended up plugging that box into an outlet and running the ethernet cable into the attic and outside to my camera.  I mounted it under the roof line on a side of the house that doesn't get blowing rain.  The install was easy enough and there were plenty of adjustments I could make to get the picture just right.  I ran all of my cables first and made sure that piece was all ready, so that when I went to install the camera and plugged in the cable, it was online and transmitting.  I took my 6" tablet up the ladder with me so I could see a live picture from the camera as I was adjusting the focus and angel of tilt and such.  That made it so much easier, I don't like ladders and don't like reclimbing them to move it a little to the left!When done, I couldn't believe how clear the picture was for a $100 camera.  Now, I say this because I've used plenty of the DVR kits and cameras as well as some other IP cameras and I've never been very impressed.  For the first time I was impressed with a $100 camera.  This did exactly what I was wanting.  I wanted a nice crisp clear picture that would let me see a live view of what was happening in my driveway and yard.  This isn't a zoom in and see a license plate camera, but you aren't going to get that in this price range.  I've had it running now for about 6mths and have not had one issue with it.The on board web configuration software is just fine and I didn't have any issues with getting it configured.  I really only use this as a live view camera, I don't use any recording or capture software.  It has worked on all of my pad and smartphone devices as well as over the internet.Wonderful camera for the money.  They also make very good wifi devices which I also highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Plays well with Ubiquiti bridge radios.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Emmert "I'm here because you broke...

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2NJB6ZPGP9BRDcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2NJB6ZPGP9BRDcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:08 MinsThese megapixel cameras are very light weight and their mounting brackets are much better than Foscam's - you can even run your Cat5 through the center of the mount. The image quality is good at 720 and they work surprisingly well even when it's nearly dark - without infrared. I use one above the garage to see when packages have arrived. When used with Blue Iris, you get motion sensitivity, saved image alerts and the usual features. They also work with Android's IP Cam Viewer. The thing that makes these cameras cool is their ability to get network and POE from other Ubiquiti products: NanoStation M2s/M5s have a second ethernet port that can feed a camera or another bridge radio with POE turned on or off. The NanoStation bridge radios go for miles, enabling you to connect houses, barns and shops with cameras at each location. Ubiquiti's POE makes installation much easier than having to bundle up thick cables inside a junction box or drill large holes to pass them through walls. Thankfully, each item comes with its own POE injector. No odd cables or adapters required - just Cat5. Speaking of Ubiquiti's included 24-volt POE adapters, their polarity may differ from other injectors you may be using. Positive is on pins 4&5 (blue), negative on pins 7&8 (brown).

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the Money
Reviews.Author: Mark M. "X111"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a good picture, but not great.It is much better than the 600tvl or 700tvl cameras. However, although it is 1280/720 resolution, it is not as sharp as I was expecting.To focus the camera, you have to take off the lens cover, and turn the lens. It is very sensitive to move, so you have to be careful.The housing is great. They really thought through the overall design and it has great cable management and shading capabilities that many cameras miss.The software it comes with looks good, but is overcomplicated and buggy. It is worth a few bucks to just use "Blue Iris" software instead.I am growing to love the Ubiquiti products and this AirCam did not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Very good quality picture
Reviews.Author: J. Canfield "John - old geek"
Reviews.Content: I am a big fan of Ubiquiti wireless products, I have their Bullets and Nanos all over our ranch bringing network connectivity to several out buildings and our house.  I needed an IP cam to monitor the water level in our water storage tanks so I thought I would give this inexpensive cam a try.One of my primary requirements was a PoE cam - no ridiculous dongles or power supply bricks to deal with in an outdoor setting and I wanted a weatherproof outdoor enclosure.  Since I did NOT need motion detection or FTP/email features, this cam seemed to perfectly fit my requirements.  When I need to check to check the water level, I simply log into the cam and have a look.  Periodic emailing of a picture would have been a nice feature, but that's not a critical requirement.As other reviews have mentioned, the plastic case at first seemed a little flimsy and low-end quality but it's really okay and quite functional.  I do have a complaint about the mounting bracket, you cannot point the camera at a 90 degree angle relative to the mounting bracket (foot.)  I had to make a wedge angled at about 15 degrees to mount to the building and then mount the cam to the wedge.I have no idea about Ubiquiti's DVR software, didn't use it and don't have a need to continuously record an image.The cam was easy to set up, there aren't a whole lot of settings to fiddle with.  Like the Ubiquiti network products, this cam has a ping watchdog that will ping an IP address and if there is no response, the cam will reboot itself (I set mine up to ping our primary router.)  With some hesitation I will mention that I have never had a network failure of any kind, the Bullets and Nanos are extremely reliable and if something goes stupid, they can all reboot themselves.  Very impressive reliability and I expect the same from this cam.As far as the cam image, it is outstanding for a camera in this price range - I have IP cams from the $100 to $600 price range (Panasonic, WansView, Toshiba, Mole, etc.) running and this cam's picture is amazing.  The color balance is the very best of any cam I have ever used.A caveat:  this cam likes daylight and is not a low light cam.  If you need a good low-light or no-light performer, look for another product.

Reviews.Title: Works great for the $, however
Reviews.Author: J. Magar "JAM"
Reviews.Content: Works great for the $, however if you are looking for true 720P this is not it!  I am sure the camera and stuff is 720P however the compression is so heavy it's more like 540.  Blurry even with tweeking all the settings and adjusting the focus of the camera.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Kevinp
Reviews.Content: Was not too impressed overall. Video is ok but the web user interface is very limited. I can't knock it too hard because the price was so low. Was disappointed it would not work with standard POE switch, and had to run extra power cord for the Ubiquiti POE injector. Camera image appears slightly out of focus, it seems due to the lens. After several tries I could not achieve a better focus.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera and software, but I wish it had IR / night vision ability.
Reviews.Author: Michael J Finnell
Reviews.Content: Great camera, great software, from a great company I just wish it had the ability to see IR sensing ability.  Unfortunately the filter which greatly improves day time quality strips out the IR.  Since this is the only outdoor camera from UBNT it becomes a very glaring omission.

Reviews.Title: Good and cheap; murky picture
Reviews.Author: Jeremy A. Cole
Reviews.Content: Solid and well-designed as any Ubiquiti product, but the picture is pretty murky. I wish the picture were clearer for taking snapshots. For video it's basically fine.

Reviews.Title: I was expecting it to be sharper...
Reviews.Author: B. Ellis
Reviews.Content: I was expecting it to be sharper... I have adjusted all of the setting mentioned here and that did help a lot, but not quite there.  Still a nice cam.  I don't know why it does not use standard POE but not that big of a deal and good they include their POE adapter.  I believe you could find the pin out to use a standard POE switch if you were so inclined.  The build seems solid and more of a commercial grade than some of the many others I own.  The mount is nifty for sure but lacks some flexibility to use a standard bottom mount.  I wasn't looking for night vision and knew that when I bought it.  It works well with iCam software and is easy to setup.  I chose not to go the AirVision software route to manage it, but that looks very capable as well.  A couple of other nits - No FTP capability and if you want to stream video outside of a managed program you must use RSTP.  Management interface is top shelf.  You can tell that this is geared for commercial use.  In spite of the negatives I do like this cam and the price is right.

Reviews.Title: great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Tyler Lura
Reviews.Content: has a few streaming limitations but rtsp functionality works great.  i have this installed outside in a pretty extreme weather environment and appears to be holding up.  good picture quality as well..

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Overall, I'm very happy with this product.  The picture isn't great, but the combination of low price, POE capability, weather resistance, and durability more than make up for that shortcoming.The software is fair - I'm more of a fan of BlueIris.

Reviews.Title: It's worth what it cost
Reviews.Author: Kevin Mahler
Reviews.Content: I own several network cameras.  An Aircam, an Aircam Mini and a Panasonic Wireless Cam.  Even though the Aircam's are higher resolution, they are not as sharp as the Panasonic.  Even though I paid more than twice the price for the Panasonic, I feel it's worth every penny over the Aircams.  I have tried adjusting the focus and bit rates on the Aircams but nothing helps.

Reviews.Title: Non standard
Reviews.Author: Basilio
Reviews.Content: This camera isn't a "standard" camera. For standard I mean cameras close to plug-and-play.I'm running over 18 cameras at the moment and planning to increase the number so I decided to try this Ubiquiti camera.The POE by default is an extreme choice as it implies the usage of the provided adapted and so I cannot use a centralized power supply as I'm doing for the other cameras.The design is nice but proprietary. No standard holder/stand can be used with this camera, you have to use the provided one.The triangular section of the camera makes the fixing mandatory even for testing purposes, the apex of the triangle is facing downstairs so the camera can't stand on his own neither on a camera tripod, which I'm using for testing cameras.Image quality isn't "amazing" let's say it's average and I notice several point of out-of-focus on the mid-top of the image.To put the lens on focus the front protection must be unscrew and inside there is a very thin O-ring for weather protection.The software provided seems to be amazing but useless unless you have a single brand cameras by Ubiquiti.The camera is fully compatible with Blue Iris.I'm considering this camera expensive as it doesn't provide night view, wireless and standard installation.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing image quality, good software
Reviews.Author: C. Wood
Reviews.Content: Based on the other reviews, perhaps I was expecting too much in the image quality department. I am using a Dropcam Pro as a reference, and with both at 720p, the Aircam image is comparatively very poor. You can switch the aircam resolution from 720p to 480p and see very little change in the image.Also the dropcam 135 degree wide angle is a plus in my application, versus the approx. 45 degree view of the aircam.On the plus side, I like that I am able to run my own server at a reasonable cost with the aircam. With the Dropcam you're pretty much hooked into a $10/month charge for the rest of your life. The free AirVision software for the Aircam is pretty good. I'm running it under Ubuntu on an old macbook running a Parallels virtual machine. Since the motion detection software runs on the camera, my old macbook has enough power to run the server --- it struggles with other cameras and software where the motion detection is on the server.With Airvision you can set up motion detection zones with arbitrarily complex shapes. You can't set up individual alert policies for the different zones, however. You have have to receive alerts from all zones of a camera or none. The alerts do include the name of the zone, so I use email filters manage the alerts I want to see. It would also be good if there was a way to trigger a shell script instead of sending an email when an alert is raised.

Reviews.Title: Wish it had night vision though
Reviews.Author: Paul B. Bergman
Reviews.Content: Good camera during the day. Their free DVR software worked well and is easy to install (once you find it.)I wish it had night-vision though. There isn't enough light from the streetlight at night to get a good image.  Also, I wish it integrated with MiCasa Verde better.

Reviews.Title: mount sucks, camera is great
Reviews.Author: Chris M. Wollesen
Reviews.Content: the mount will work if you're not planning an exterior application, but it wobbles like crap from the wind.  use 2x4's and make your own like i did and you'll be much happier when using it outside.  I learned it the hard way after a mount broke from the vibration caused by wind.

Reviews.Title: Another installation book that dead ends; image not much better than $79 cameras subjectively speaking and not worth hassles
Reviews.Author: Florida "merbine"
Reviews.Content: Another piece of hardware not supported well by the software but at least the folks have tried to help--seems like others are having their issues as well but basically the image doesn't appear to be much better than a cheap Foscam and in  order to take advantage of the higher definition it is unclear how to do that without trying to make their software work since manuf. tells you they are not supported by 3d party vendors.  But how does Robert Chou do great things for free with his IP Cam Viewer for smartphones, including listing Ubiquiti cameras as supported by him, for free, when others, including this software developer have trouble with more powerful Windows machines.  I don't understand it but a number of 3d party vendors do mention this camera....it's just that it doesn't seem to have that great of an image in low light levels or even daylight to differentiate it, cost-wise, from cheaper cameras plus it doesn't give you audio or PTZ.  I know this company does some good things with AP's, etc., but  manufacturers need to remember that when the average buyer purchases a complicated car, that seller doesn't expect the buyer to dig into the guts of the car to make the Goodyear tires work on the Toyota wheels with Brand X gas and Brand Y oil.  I've set up several different brands of wireless and wired DVR's, IP cams, servers, etc.  and this isn't one of the easier ones so i expected a significantly better image in exchange.  Disappointed. Software has issues with Internet Explorer, apparently, and favors other browsers, for starters, so that when you follow booklets directions, you run into a brick wall with installation / download.  From there it gets funner.  Improve the software and drop the price to match the image and features please.

Reviews.Title: Not so good
Reviews.Author: MauiBoy
Reviews.Content: Made of plastic materials. I am not confident that it will last long if mounter outdoor under the sun... disappointed with the video quality... below average.

Reviews.Title: rock solid
Reviews.Author: Bryan
Reviews.Content: I'm using this product with Blue Iris. Its works flawlessly. Installed 3 at a friends house and they are using them in conjunction with IP Cam Viewer app for iphone, No problems.

Reviews.Title: Really nice  camera
Reviews.Author: bwolz
Reviews.Content: Great product.  good image, easy setup.  It came on time and really worked great. It is packaged well.  I love it!!!!!

Reviews.Title: UBNT needs to hurry up with their Software!
Reviews.Author: WeirdExponent
Reviews.Content: Camera is solid.Mounting seems easily broken.Software is adequate for one or two cameras on a cheap computer, yet it reports extremely high CPU usage constantly.Next version of software has been promised for about a year now... with only closed beta sign up recently.  Hopefully it will run on minimal hardware specs with minimal bugs.I wouldn't deploy it in mass yet... one or two camera setup might be ok.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the Price
Reviews.Author: Darrell
Reviews.Content: Great inexpensive surveillance solution for small deployments. Will need high-end server hardware for video archival and playback, but so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Great overall camera
Reviews.Author: F. Elia
Reviews.Content: Great for the price love the fact its POE. GREAT GUI. Very easy to position in any direction you want.LIKES-POE-HD-Great GUIDISLIKES-Build seems cheap-no night vision or recording

Reviews.Title: DO NOT PURCHASE THESE CAMERAS!!!
Reviews.Author: Brandon M "Brandon M"
Reviews.Content: I have now twice had to RMA an Aircam camera through Ubiquti. These things seem to die strange deaths for no reason other than the stars lined up the wrong way.I regret purchasing these cameras and if I could get my money back for them I would.The video quality is poor and the mounts are cheap. I was really excited to use these cameras, and gave them a little over a year to stick it out but I'm FED UP!Find a better product that won't fail on you randomly and if you're lucky...brick....requiring significant downtime on your security situation.

Reviews.Title: Ubiquiti Aircam H264 works well
Reviews.Author: R. Denlinger "starting thoroughbreds gently"
Reviews.Content: This camera went on an antenna so I could see where it was pointing. It runs on 200 feet of Ethernet Cat-6 cable. The web-page interface is good. At night I can resolve the quarter and greater sized Moon .. but no more than that. That is, yes I can tell it's the moon but I wouldn't want to try and see stars.That may not be a factor for you. In my case, I wish I had a little more night-time resolution WITHOUT the Infra-red LED junk. Though this is not a security camera, it would be nice if I had some magnification (Optical not pixelation) .The camera is fine for the job; works well and quite waterproof it seems judging from the strong thunderstorms it's been out in.They have a users forum. It wasn't designed for people like me though. I asked questions and had difficulty getting answers.Good inexpensive camera which does do the power-over-ethernet right out of the box, as advertised. If you want more Astronomical quality look elsewhere and also let me know what you find.This one is worth the dollars and works quite well strapped under an antenna at 50 feet up.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't have NightVision
Reviews.Author: Joseph Ades "jades"
Reviews.Content: this is a good quality camera, but does not have night vision.  I returned it  for this reason.  UBNT is a great company but need to add IR LED to the IP cameras.  Would work ok in a well lighted area.

Reviews.Title: Great during the day
Reviews.Author: Rick Fuller
Reviews.Content: Great during the day, but could definitely use IR at night. Great pic quality and unbeatable price. Also a U.S. company!

Reviews.Title: Good idea poorly implemented
Reviews.Author: G. Dunbar
Reviews.Content: The Ubiquity AirCam system looks great on paper with cheap cameras and free software designed to work with them.  The hardware is good for the money, and the power over ethernet makes for easy installation.  The problem is that the software is plagued with issues.  It requires a boatload of processing power to record just a few cameras, and the web interface is always freezing when watching recorded video.  I can't really recommend this system to anyone as it is.There is some good news though, the new version 2 of their AirCam software is available in beta. I've tried it and it resolves many of the issues. I'm hopeful it will finally make the cameras I bought useful.

Reviews.Title: Very nice value for pretty decent IP camera
Reviews.Author: Cullen Lorsung
Reviews.Content: Works great with Zoneminder or by itself.  I have not used Ubiquitis software, although I heard it was based on Zoneminder?  Super hard to beat the price on a genuine outdoor camera - have deployed these outside, unsheltered in Minnesota without complaints.  The design of the casing is really clever.

Reviews.Title: G r e a t
Reviews.Author: Luis D. Sanchez Rojas "TecnoInformática"
Reviews.Content: I've been installing cameras for a while now, but until Ubiquiti, no systems is as easy to use or configure, you spend 1 or 2 minutes installing the camera, no hassles with bnc conectors, electrical power if fed through the same UTP CAT5 cable, both ends using a RJ45 connector.The servers I use are Linux based (Ubuntu), no problems at all, the software configuration is a breeze (Dummy based), i fully recomend these IP cameras.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: JRod
Reviews.Content: Best bang for the buck HD camera I've seen so far.  I have seen many other products from this company and I've never had a single gripe from anyone.  Great company, great products.Updated - 1/12/13Removed one star for VERY poor low-light abilities.  Comparing captured frames to the Panasonic BL-C1A, at dusk the Ubiquiti appears almost black, yet the Panasonic looks like it is daytime.

Reviews.Title: Okay, but...
Reviews.Author: Capt Bob
Reviews.Content: This camera works but its web interface is proprietary making it difficult to run with other brands of cameras. However, if all you need is a few outdoor cameras that are inexpensive this model will do the job. If you already have another brand of camera on your network I would no recommend adding this one as you will need two separate viewers to see your cameras.

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: Donna Whitmyer
Reviews.Content: POOR quality video....poor frame rate at high quality settings....seemed like a good idea at the time....only has a 10/100 connection and the frame rate is so poor I guess it is due somewhat to the data not being able to move back and forth fast enough for high quality video

Reviews.Title: Software doesn't work, so camera doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Main Street
Reviews.Content: Doesn't recognize username and password. So it won't let you manage the cameras because you can't get to them. You are stuck in the authentication screen. Therefore, you can't even see the video. Looked up their forums and its a known problem. Even after re installing twice, it did not fix the problem. I am using a PC with win7. Very frustrating. Time to return this junk.

ProductInfo.Features:
Advanced industrial design
Powerful performance
Excellent price/performance IP Camera
1MP/HDTV 720p
Wall/Ceiling Mount
Powered through Ethernet
Simple and intuitive user interface
ProductInfo.Name: Ubiquiti Aircam H.264 Megapixel Indoor/Outdoor IP Camera
